lines.text: Why couldn't they say "Buddha, bless you" in Chinese?
Because they don't say that, that's why. If they say... Well, if they say anything at all, it's "Sayonara".
That's Japanese.
Same thing.
It's not the same thing!
What are you talking about? You put a Jap and a Chink together, you gonna tell me which is which?
That's right, because I find out about them. I talk to them as individuals.
Sure you talk to them. You say, "Which one of you guys is the Chink?"

[yells]
I don't believe this. He's making me crazy!
In today's society, people throw things out because they don't work.
Well you don't work, maybe we should throw you out.
culture.
[Shows him the art exhibit book]
A Polack art exhibit.
That's 'Pollock'. Jackson Pollock. He happens to be a great American artist.
he splashes and smears the paint over everything here. What do you mean? A monkey could do that. A great American artist? There ain't a tree or a flag or a president in the whole damn book.
I'd explain it to you, Arch, but first you'd have to move your brain ahead two centuries.
Why don't you go take a short walk on a long pier?
Ha, you can't even get that right! It's take a long walk off a short pier.
Then do that.
I just thank God I'm an atheist.
[repeated line]
Get out of my chair, Meathead!
Where's my grandson?
He's asleep.
Well wake him up.
He's tired.
But every time I come over here the kid is either in bed, in the bath tub or on the pot.
You know, pizza's actually not from Italy. I read that Marco Polo discovered it in China and then brought it back to Italy.
Leave it to a dago to go halfway around the world to get a take-home meal.
[Edith hands Archie a beer on the left side instead of the usual right]
What are you doing?
I thought you might like it on this side for a change.
Is it gonna taste better on this side?
What were you saying about colored families having no love?
Why is it you can remember everything except how to work?
Do you know that sixty percent of all deaths in America are caused by guns?
Would it make you feel any better, little girl, if they was pushed out of windows?
Go out and get me a beer.
Can or bottle?
We never buy bottles.
You go off and leave me here with nobody home.
Mike was here.
Like I said, nobody was home.
What are you fighting about?
The Star-Spangled Banner.
Did the singer forget the words again?
[Door bell rings]

[Running]
I'll get it!
Geez Louise Edith, why do you have to charge the door like a German shepherd every time the bell rings?
Like the Good Book says, "Let him who is without sin... be the rollin' stone."
[repeated line]
Waaaaaaait a minute, waaaaaaait a minute, wait!
You know, you are totally incomprehensible.
Maybe so, but I make a lot of sense.
If he's gonna have the last laugh, I'm gonna have it first.
Free treatment for VD. VD. Do you know what *that* means, Edith?
oh, yeah. V-D day.
[Edith's high school is being torn down to build a grocery store]
It won't be the same saying "I went to school there," while pointing at the A&P.
God created the universe in seven days.
Six days. On the seventh day he rested.
Well only for a while then He looked over what He done.
Mike is family.
Gloria is family. What's standing behind me is an accident of marriage.
Remember Sister Kate, Archie?
That was that dumb movie about nuns starring Ingrid Bernstein.
Maybe before I come to bed I should put on my socks.
Maybe before you come to bed you should stick your feet in the oven.
You eat my heart out. Little by little, bit by bit, you eat my heart out.
I don't care.
Say there, Rosemarie.
Stephanie.
Whatever.
Don't ya like me bringin' home surprises?
Geez, Edith... with you a surprise could be anything from a runaway horse to a Puerto Rican.
Archie, if there *is* a God, how come there's so much unhappiness in the world?
If there is a God how come there's so much unhappiness in the world? Uh... uh... hey, Edith... If there *is* a God, how come there's so much unhappiness in the world?
Oh, Daddy. You'd put ketchup on a doughnut.
If it needed it.
[repeated line]
You know somethin', Edith? You're a pip. You know that? A real pip.
[repeated line]
The Reverend Fletcher...
Felcher.
WHATEVER.
Everyone I like stays the hell away from me.
Hi Dad, where's Ma?
I don't know, she flew out of here like a dingbat outta Hell.
Daddy, what I don't understand is how can the Duke be alive if he threw himself on a grenade?
'Cause it was an Italian grenade. It was a dud like everything else them Pasta-Fazoos made.
educational TV only.
I'll drive a truck, pump gas, collect garbage.
Bingo. Start collecting the garbage off of the table.
His chest is all puffed out like Raquel Walsh.
A man should always listen to his wife.
Archie, I...
Dummy up.
I tell ya, Edith, when a plumber's business goes into the toilet you're sitting pretty.
I'm home. I'm home, Archie.
Are you sure?
Silence is golden, so stifle thy self.

[on the phone]
Hello, sweetheart, how's my little pussycat?
You know, you ought to try that.
You think so?
[on the phone with Edith]
Hello, sweetheart, how's my little pussycat?
[pause]
She hung up the phone.
Edith, if you call me "Cute" one more time, I swear I'll open a vein.
You'd better start mixing toothpaste with your shampoo. You're getting a cavity in your brain.
You can't do that, Archie! That's largesse!
I don't care if it's largesse, smallesse or any kind of esse!

[Archie's in the bathroom]
Archie! When are ya comin' out?
Why, ya sellin' the house?
You've been in there for 20 minutes.
Who are you? The official time-keeper?
What are ya doin' in there?
I'm changing the tile. One more word out of ya and I ain't never comin' out!
That's what's wrong with this country; nobody asks questions any more!
Can I ask *you* a question?
Sure.
Why don't you shut up?
[repeated line]
Dummy up, dummy up!
[repeated line]
Get away from me!
[repeated line]
Case CLOSED!
We should take you to the doctor.
No, I've already had one attempted robbery today.
You worse than that hebe congressman Sam Irving.
Whatever happened to the good old days when kids was scared to death of their parents?
I got bigger fish to fly.
Your honor, may I encroach the bench?
[repeated line]
Button your face.
In my bed I stay, 'til death us do part.
Why don't you go out and finish dinner.
Nah, I ain't hungry.
Ya can't depend on nothing no more.
You gotta grab the bull by the corns.

[commenting on a woman's perfume]
It infiltrates the nosetrils.

[telling the story of Samson]
He took a jawbone from the grass and slew the Palestine army.
We was like two ships that clashed in the night.
She ain't gonna saying nothing more because the smoke has given her an attack of, what do you call, laryngosis.
God can do anything! He can turn your jawbone into an ass!
God don't make no mistakes, that's how He got to be God.
You're a regular Edgar Allen Polack.
What has four legs, and flys?
Two pairs of pants!
